subsetsum

Class SubsetSum

  • java.lang.Object
    • subsetsum.SubsetSum

  • public class SubsetSum
extends java.lang.Object
    Algorithm to solve the Subset Sum problem. As per class modules, the subset sum problem is a pair (S, t), where S = {x1, x2, ... xn} is a set of positive integers and t (the target) is a positive integer. The problem asks for a subset of S whose sum is as large as possible, but not larger than t. The below algorithm has exponential time complexity but has modest efficiency improvements.
    Author:
    anuva

    • Method Detail

      • findSubset

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> findSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> shoppingList,
                                                               double budget)
        Computes the subset L' of shoppingList with the sum(L') as large as possible but less than or equal to duration. Solves Subset Sum Problem with efficiency improvements.
        Parameters:
        shoppingList - ArrayList of Double representing the prices of items in the shopping list
        budget - double representing user's target budget
        Returns:
        an ArrayList representing a list of items to buy

      • runSubsetSum

        private static Sublist runSubsetSum(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> list,
                                    double budget)
        Use Subset Sum algorithm to generate sublist of groceries closest to user's target budget
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of Double representing the prices of items in the shopping list. This list only has items with price less than or equal to target budget from shopping list
        budget - double representing user's target budget
        Returns:
        Sublist representing subset closest to target budget

      • handleExactMatch

        private static Sublist handleExactMatch(java.util.ArrayList<Sublist> candidates,
                                        int i,
                                        Sublist sublist)
        Get sublist of groceries that is an exact match to user's target budget.
        Parameters:
        candidates - List of potential candidate subsets
        i - index of item in trimmed grocery list to add to list of potential candidates
        sublist - subset representing groceries that are an exact match to budget
        Returns:
        sublist of groceries that is an exact match to user's target budget.

      • handleClosestMatch

        private static Sublist handleClosestMatch(java.util.ArrayList<Sublist> candidates,
                                          Sublist currentBest,
                                          int i,
                                          Sublist sublist)
        Returns subset of groceries that is closest to meeting the user's budget. Invokes addItem(int) to generate a new subset from an existing subset and adds sublist to list of potential candidates. Updates the current best known subset if the sum of the newly added sublist is closer to the user's budget.
        Parameters:
        candidates - ArrayList of Sublist objects representing potential subset candidates
        currentBest - current best known subset of groceries
        i - index of item in list
        sublist - Sublist object that is a potential candidate
        Returns:
        Sublist representing current best known subset of groceries

      • trimShoppingList

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> trimShoppingList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> shoppingList,
                                                                      double budget)
        This method trims the original shopping list to only include items with price less than or equal to the budget
        Parameters:
        shoppingList - original shopping list
        budget - user's budget which determines a list of items to buy
        Returns:
        list with only items less than or equal to the budget

      • findSubsetOfSongs

        public static java.util.ArrayList<SongEntry> findSubsetOfSongs(java.util.ArrayList<SongEntry> songList,
                                                               double budget)
        Computes a subset of songs with total duration equal to exact match of user's target duration or closest match to the user's target duration Uses Subset Sum Algorithm with an optimization where unnecessary subsets are discarded. For example, if we are able to construct a bigger subset L+x, from the smaller subset L, the smaller subset L is discarded. This optimization helps the algorithm process larger data sets.
        Parameters:
        songList - list of SongEntry objects, where each SongEntry represents a song
        budget - target duration of desired play list in minutes
        Returns:
        sublist of songs with total duration equal to exact match of target duration or closest match to the target duration

      • runSubsetSumForSongs

        private static SublistSong runSubsetSumForSongs(java.util.ArrayList<SongEntry> list,
                                                double duration)
        Use Subset Sum algorithm to generate sublist of songs closest to user's target play list duration
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of SongEntry representing the songs in the play list. This list only has songs with duration less than or equal to target play list duration from master song list
        duration - double representing user's target play list duration
        Returns:
        SublistSong representing subset of songs closest to target duration

      • handleExactMatch

        private static SublistSong handleExactMatch(java.util.ArrayList<SublistSong> candidates,
                                            int i,
                                            SublistSong sublist)
        Returns subset of songs that exactly match user's target play list duration. Invokes addItem(int) to generate a new subset from an existing subset and adds sublist to list of potential candidates.
        Parameters:
        candidates - ArrayList of SublistSong objects representing potential subset candidates.
        i - index of item in play list
        sublist - SublistSong object that is a potential candidate
        Returns:
        SublistSong representing current best known subset of songs

      • handleClosestMatch

        private static SublistSong handleClosestMatch(java.util.ArrayList<SublistSong> candidates,
                                              SublistSong currentBest,
                                              int i,
                                              SublistSong sublist)
        Returns subset of songs that is closest to meeting the user's target play list duration. Invokes addItem(int) to generate a new subset from an existing subset and adds sublist to list of potential candidates. Updates the current best known subset if the sum of the play times of newly added sublist is closer to the user's target play list duration. In order to handle large data set, optimizes by discarding unnecessary subsets. For example, if sublist (L + x) is created from smaller subset L, we can throw away L
        Parameters:
        candidates - ArrayList of SublistSong objects representing potential subset candidates.
        currentBest - current best known subset of songs
        i - index of item in play list
        sublist - SublistSong object that is a potential candidate
        Returns:
        SublistSong representing current best known subset of songs

        Returns the duration of song at position i in the song list
        Parameters:

        i - index of the song in the list
        Returns:
        duration of the ith song in the list

        This method trims the original song list to only include songs with duration less than or equal to the target duration

        Returns:
